response: *Thomas James Smith (1827–1896), pharmacist and founder of the medical equipment firm Smith & Nephew

link_mentions.page: List of companies named after people
response: * Smith and Nephew – Thomas James Smith and nephew Horatio Nelson Smith
*Thomas James Smith (1827–1896), founder of Smith & Nephew, one of the United Kingdom's largest medical devices businesses

The company was founded in 1856 by Thomas James Smith of Kingston upon Hull who went into business as a dispensing chemist. A few months before his death in 1896, Smith was joined by his nephew, Horatio Nelson Smith, and the business became known as T. J. Smith and Nephew.

Thomas James Smith, also known as Tom "Bear River" Smith, (12 June 1830 – 2 November 1870) was a lawman in the American Old West and briefly marshal of cattle town Abilene, Kansas. He was killed and nearly decapitated in the line of duty.
